description: A structured JSON representation of Pipedrive's design elements, layout patterns, and user experience philosophy for web design reference.

corePrinciples: Activity-first planning keeps sales teams focused on the next high-impact task.
Clarity in hierarchy ensures data-dense views remain easy to scan and prioritize.
Visual consistency across the suite reinforces user trust and predictability.
Customization empowers teams to adapt the CRM to their pipeline and vocabulary.
Guided automation reduces manual work while surfacing the most relevant insights.
experienceGoals: Deliver immediate situational awareness on every page so representatives know what to do next.
Support high-speed entry and editing with keyboard-friendly patterns and inline actions.
Provide subtle encouragement through microcopy and prompts without overwhelming the user.
Maintain accessibility with high-contrast defaults, semantic structure, and focus management.

logo.description: A minimalist, lowercase 'p' with soft, rounded forms. Designed for readability at all sizes and to complement the soft UI elements of the dashboard.
usageGuidelines: Maintain clear space equal to the logomark's bowl radius on all sides.
Prefer the monochrome version against complex photography or gradients.
Avoid tilting, stretching, or applying drop shadows that conflict with the soft UI language.
When paired with typography, align baseline with the wordmark set in the primary sans-serif family.

styleGuide.title: 확장형 모던 & 미니멀 팔레트 (Neutral Gray + Blue Accent)
styleGuide.summary: Neutral gray foundations with precise royal blue accents convey a calm, professional CRM aesthetic that prioritizes focus and whitespace.

lightMode.name: Light Mode
lightMode.description: Default bright experience that keeps contrast gentle while letting Royal Blue accents direct attention.

roles.usage: 전체 배경, 카드 영역 (application canvas and spacious dashboards).
컴포넌트 표면, 입력 필드, 카드 배경.
배지, 알림 배경, 경고 완화 영역.
버튼 및 입력 배경, 플로팅 카드.

implementationNotes: Expose light mode tokens as :root CSS variables prefixed with --color-light-.
Pair muted neutral surfaces with the Royal Blue accent for interaction cues without overwhelming the layout.

darkMode.name: Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Low-light presentation balancing deep charcoals with luminous blue states for focus during evening sessions.

roles.usage: 전체 배경, 라이트 모드 대비 저조도 환경.
블루 톤의 강조 배경, 서브 패널.

implementationNotes: Register dark mode tokens under .dark selectors to align with Tailwind's dark variant.
Use translucent overlays of Blue Overlay for hover states to preserve depth without harsh contrast.

typography.fontFamily: Clean, high-contrast sans-serif font such as Inter, Lato, or similar with optical sizing for digital displays.
principles: Use sentence case for navigation labels and call-to-action text.
Balance dense data tables with generous line-height (1.5+) for readability.
Reserve bold weights for emphasis in metrics, stage names, and automation triggers.
Pair sans-serif headings with subtle serif or monospace accents only in code or API contexts.

typeScale.usage: Helper text, badge labels, and timestamps.

principles: Confident but friendly, focusing on guidance rather than instruction.
Use actionable verbs that inspire momentum (e.g., 'Schedule', 'Follow up', 'Organize').
Offer contextual empathy, acknowledging sales challenges and next-best actions.
Prefer concise messaging that can be scanned quickly by multitasking reps.
microcopyPatterns: Celebrate wins with short, punchy phrases ("Deal won! Keep the pipeline flowing.").
Prompt next actions with direct questions ("Who should follow up next?").
Clarify automation impacts with plain language and an optional Learn more link.

mainStructure.description: A persistent, customizable main navigation on the left, with the primary content area on the right.

features: Supports collapse/expand with tooltip labels for quick scanning.
Surface level status indicators (notifications, live chat) next to relevant icons.
Includes customizable pin slots for most-used pipelines or apps.
Houses global search with keyboard shortcut focus (⌘/Ctrl + K).
Displays breadcrumbs, filters, and quick actions relevant to the active module.
Hosts team switcher and pipeline stage filters.
Provides inline analytics chips summarizing progress.

coreViews.name: Pipeline Board
coreViews.description: Kanban columns representing deal stages with drag-and-drop cards and in-line metrics.
keyElements: Column headers show count, weighted value, and stage velocity.
Deal cards highlight owner avatar, value, and next activity badge.
Supports drag handles and keyboard reordering for accessibility.
Includes quick filters for team, value, and inactivity.

coreViews.name: Deal Detail View
coreViews.description: Split view with main timeline and contextual sidebar for related data.
keyElements: Tabs organize timeline, emails, files, and custom fields.
Sidebar panel houses apps, linked deals, and automation recipes.
Activity composer floats at the bottom for swift follow-up.
Progress bar visualizes stage history and stagnation.

coreViews.name: Insights Dashboard
coreViews.description: Widget-based reporting canvas with customizable layouts and filters.
keyElements: Widgets snap to a responsive grid with drag-and-drop rearrangement.
Supports saved views and scheduled email digests.
Each widget exposes drill-down paths into detailed reports.
Color palette shifts to support high-contrast data visualization.

components.name: Global Navigation Sidebar
components.description: Primary vertical navigation rail with iconography, tooltips, and customizable shortcuts.
attributes: Collapsible with persistent quick-add button.
Supports status dots for notifications and unread counts.
Includes profile summary and organization switcher at the bottom.

components.name: Quick Add Modal
components.description: A modal window for creating new items (Deals, Activities, etc.) without leaving the current page.
attributes: Pre-populates context (owner, pipeline) based on the originating view.
Includes quick templates and AI-assisted field suggestions.
Supports keyboard shortcuts and step indicators for multi-stage creation.

components.name: Hovercard
components.description: A small pop-up that appears on hover over an entity (e.g., a person's name) to provide a quick summary of key information.
attributes: Displays avatar, last activity, and recent notes.
Offers quick actions like call, email, or schedule activity.
Anchors intelligently to avoid viewport clipping.

components.name: Web Form Builder
components.description: A tool for creating embeddable web forms to capture leads directly into the CRM.
attributes: Drag-and-drop fields with validation previews.
Supports theme selection matching the CRM brand guidelines.
Provides conversion analytics and spam protection settings.

components.name: Sidebar Panel
components.description: A panel within the Detail View used for displaying contextual information or third-party app integrations.
attributes: Extensible via the developer platform using iframes.
Fixed width, variable height.
Supports collapsible sections and persistent pinning.

components.name: Dashboard Widget
components.description: A modular component for the Insights dashboard.
attributes: Visualizes data (charts, graphs, KPIs).
Customizable and arrangeable by the user.
Supports exporting snapshots to shared channels.

components.name: Progress Bar
components.description: A visual timeline in the Deal Detail View showing how long a deal has been in each stage of the pipeline.
attributes: Provides at-a-glance status and identifies stalled deals.
Displays tooltips with timestamps and responsible owners.
Color-coded to represent pace against benchmarks.

components.name: Tabs
components.description: Used within views (like the Detail View) to organize different types of related content.
attributes: Common tabs include 'Activity', 'Notes', 'Files', 'Emails'.
Supports overflow with horizontal scrolling and keyboard focus.
Integrates with permissions to show or hide sensitive sections.

coreFlows.name: Lead Qualification
coreFlows.goal: Assess incoming leads and schedule the first activity.
steps: Receive web form submission and auto-enrich with company data.
Review hovercard insights to confirm lead quality.
Schedule a follow-up activity using the quick add modal.
Assign the lead to the appropriate pipeline stage with drag-and-drop.
Log the outcome and trigger nurture automation if needed.

coreFlows.name: Deal Progression
coreFlows.goal: Advance a deal from qualification to proposal with minimal friction.
steps: Open the deal detail view from the pipeline board.
Review the progress bar to identify stalled stages.
Collaborate via notes tab and mention teammates for support.
Use the sidebar panel to launch integrations (e.g., DocuSign).
Update the next activity and move the deal to the next stage.

coreFlows.name: Automated Workflow
coreFlows.goal: Create an automation that nurtures dormant deals and alerts the team.
steps: Launch workflow builder from the dashboard widget quick actions.
Define conditional paths using drag-and-drop nodes.
Configure notifications and automatic activity creation.
Review summary, activate workflow, and monitor analytics.

interactionPatterns.dragAndDrop: Core interaction for managing the Kanban pipeline, widgets, and workflow automation nodes.
interactionPatterns.automation: A key UX principle to eliminate repetitive tasks and guide users toward high-value actions.
interactionPatterns.contextualPrompts: The system actively prompts for the next action to reinforce the activity-based methodology.
interactionPatterns.crossPlatformConsistency: A deliberate strategy to ensure a seamless and predictable experience between desktop and mobile apps.
interactionPatterns.assistiveAI: Inline AI guidance suggests email copy, summarizes deal context, and recommends outreach cadences.

trainingReferences: Use core principles and tone-of-voice guidance to fine-tune conversational assistants.
Incorporate layout grid metrics to maintain consistency when generating new views.
Ensure generated color combinations respect contrast ratios (WCAG AA or higher).
dataConsiderations: Protect personally identifiable information when displaying hovercards or automation logs.
Surface audit trails for AI-suggested actions to maintain trust with sales teams.
Allow opt-in for AI features with transparent usage analytics.

prototyping.handoff: Export design tokens (colors, typography) as JSON for direct integration with Tailwind configuration.
